• Among them are a slew of local protections for LGBTQ+ people, rules that city contractors pay a living wage

items.title: Gum disease may quietly damage the brain, scientists warn
bullets: • Chronic oral inflammation could subtly impact the brain, especially in older adults, according to a new study
• White matter consists of bundles of nerve fibers that allow different parts of the brain to communicate
• When this tissue is damaged, it can interfere with memory, reasoning, balance and coordination

bullets: • Pierre Robert, the voice of Philadelphia rock radio for 44 years, died Wednesday

• He was a passionate fan of the Grateful Dead, but he was an especially unwavering champion of hometown bands

items.title: NPM flooded with malicious packages downloaded more than 86,000 times
bullets: • Attackers are exploiting a major weakness that has allowed them access to the NPM code repository
• The finding brings attention to an NPM practice that allows installed packages to automatically pull down and run unvetted packages from untrusted domains
• The PhantomRaven attackers exploited this weakness by including code in the 126 packages uploaded to NPM

items.title: The Microsoft Azure Outage Shows the Harsh Reality of Cloud Failures

• The company website, including its investor relations page, was still down on Wednesday afternoon
• The incident marks the second major cloud provider outage in less than two weeks

items.title: Two crucial Florida coral species left ‘functionally extinct’ by ocean heatwave
bullets: • Two of the most important coral species that made up Florida’s reef are now functionally extinct after a withering ocean heatwave caused catastrophic losses
• The “functional extinction” is a stage before global extinction, a threat that now looms for many coral species
• Scientists this month warned that a tipping point had been reached whereby corals around the world are set to be wiped out
